sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a trapezium.
message_1: A trapezium has parallel sides of 8 cm and 12 cm, and the other two sides are 5 cm each. What is the perimeter of this trapezium?
message_2:
To find the perimeter of the trapezium, we simply add up the lengths of all its sides.

Perimeter = (first parallel side) + (second parallel side) + (first non-parallel side) + (second non-parallel side)

Perimeter = 8 cm + 12 cm + 5 cm + 5 cm = 30 cm

The perimeter of the trapezium is 30 cm.
